attributes.action: formally apologise on the floor of the House of Commons for his governments total lack of respect to the veterans of the Normandy landings by failing to invite Her Majesty the Queen to the 65th anniversary ceremonies
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition has already been rejected once on the grounds that;"the statement does not request any action". This is wrong. The action that is requested is that Gordon Brown issues an apology in the house of commons.Rejection just confirms the character of a prime minister not elected into that office by the people and desperate to cling onto power.

rejection.details: Under the terms and conditions of the e-petitions website we can not accept petitions unless they call for a recognisable action. Requesting the PM apologise is not considered a recognisable action.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
